intro: Struthiola ovata var. scariosa, commonly known as the scaly struthiola, is a variant of the struthiola plant characterized by its distinctive scaly leaves. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy, scaly coating that helps reduce water loss. The flowers are usually small and yellow, adding a subtle ornamental value to the plant.
